thread.title: No. 14 Notre Dame rallies for 41-31 victory over USC
thread.title_full: No. 14 Notre Dame rallies for 41-31 victory over USC

author: Seattle Times staff
title: No. 14 Notre Dame rallies for 41-31 victory over USC
text:
No. 14 Notre Dame rallies for 41-31 victory over USC Originally published October 17, 2015 at 9:24 pm USC’s Justin Davis is tackled by Notre Dame’s Jaylon Smith during the first half of their game Saturday. Notre Dame earned a 41-31 victory. (Darron Cummings/AP) Irish seal victory behind Corey Robinson’s diving catch against Trojans, who played their first game after the firing of coach Steve Sarkisian on Monday/ By Seattle Times staff The Associated Press 
SOUTH BEND, Ind. — Corey Robinson made a diving catch in the end zone midway through the fourth quarter and No. 14 Notre Dame rebounded to beat USC 41-31 on Saturday after squandering a two-touchdown lead. 
C.J. Prosise ran for 143 yards and two touchdowns, and DeShone Kizer threw two scoring passes, the second the 10-yarder to Robinson that made it 38-31. 
“Our theme all week was the mental toughness that we wanted to exhibit today, it was the one question we wanted to answer,” Notre Dame coach Brian Kelly said. “I didn’t see anything on the sideline that resembled our guys not believing they were going to come back.” 
USC played for the first time since firing coach Steve Sarkisian on Monday. Clay Helton directed the Trojans as interim coach. Helton said he was proud of the fight the Trojans showed. Most Read Stories
